item.title: Connecting an API (Java Spring) to an Android application
item.description: It has been a while since my last post but I swear I haven’t given up! It’s quite the opposite, actually.Â I had to do a project for my internship program which was basically creating a Rest API and connecting it to an Android Application. As it turns out, connecting an API to an app is more of a chore than I thought it would be. I hope I can stick with web development.

item.title: The basics of angular
item.description: A new day! Today is Thursday, October 13th. I started the day by studying Angular for a couple hours. So, today I am going to talk a bit about Angular. Today I learned about: Components Components are apparently a big part of Angular development! You can create them in the cl or create them by hand. Obviously, creating them with the cl command is a lot easier. The command is the following:

item.title: What I have been studying
item.description: I believe that, nowadays, writing a blog is just one way to make myself aware that I am studying a lot. Maybe I will talk a lot about myself, but the I.T field can sometimes be very harsh on you (or me). I am aware that, being an intern, I don’t have the same hardships as regular employees, but it can still be hard. I also feel like there are a lot of commas, but to be honest, I never properly learned how to use commas in English and, that being said, Grammarly is correcting it all for me.
